roleset.name: purchase
roleset.note: BUY-V NOTES: Frames file for 'buy' based on first sentences in large corpus (from buy.01-v predicate notes)
BUYING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry buy.01; corresponds to VN Class get-13.5.1. Framed by Claire. (from buying.01-n)

example.name: buy-v: Intransitive!
example.text: Consumers who buy at this level are more educated than they were.

example.name: buy-v: Basic transitive:
example.text: They bought $2.4 billion in Fannie Mae bonds

example.name: buy-v: With price (often subtle):
example.text: The holder buys $1000 principal amount of debentures at par.

example.name: buy-v: With price (often subtle):
example.text: TV stations bought "Cosby" reruns for record prices.

example.name: buy-v: With seller:
example.text: The company bought a wheel-loader from Dresser.

example.name: buy-v: With benefactive:
example.text: John bought his mother a dozen roses

example.name: buy-v: With benefactive:
example.text: John bought a dozen roses for his mother

example.name: buy-v: With purpose clause:
example.text: The company bought sugar on the world market to meet export commitments

example.name: buy-v: In a compound:
example.text: lower interest rates has spurred dollar buying by Japanese institutions.

example.name: buy-v: with direction
example.text: Some companies have used cash to buy back some of their shares

example.name: buy-v: With benefactive
example.text: I distinctly remember her buying bunches of daisies for herself every now and then.

example.name: buying-n: Arg 1 only
example.text: Even the minority of them who must register with the Securities and Exchange Commission as `` investment advisers '' -- people who are in the business of counseling others on the buying and selling of securities specifically -- have been enough to swamp the agency 's capacity .

example.name: buying-n: Args 0, 1, 2
example.text: The Americans are losing their jobs at a faster rate than Canada which will impact their buying of goods and services from Canada as well.

example.name: buying-n: With price
example.text: The biggest acquisition in decades ?the buying of BSkyB for 12.000 million dollars- ...

roleset.name: accept as truth
roleset.note: BUY-V, BUY-N NOTES: Added by Julia for AMR.

example.name: buy-v
example.text: The Agency tried to convince everyone you were dead, but I didn't buy it.

example.name: buy_up-v: with purpose clause:
example.text: The company bought up sugar on the world market to meet export commitments

roleset.name: purchase completely
roleset.note: BUYOUT-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry buy.03 (buy out). Corresponds to VN class 13.5.1. (from buyout.01-n)

example.name: buy_out-v: Basic transitive
example.text: They bought out $2.4 billion in Fannie Mae bonds

example.name: buy_out-v: Basic transitive
example.text: -- Prevent companies that-1 *T*-1 have made leveraged buy - outs from getting federal tax refunds resulting from losses caused by interest payments on debt issued to finance the buy - outs , effective Aug. 2 , 1989 .

example.name: buy_into-v
example.text: We've bought into the idea that education is about training and “success”, defined monetarily, rather than learning to think critically and to challenge.
example.arg: the idea that education is about training and “success”, defined monetarily
rather than learning to think critically and to challenge

roleset.name: tranfer money to someone in exchange for a favor
roleset.note: BUY_OFF-V, BUYING_OFF-N NOTES: Added by Julia for AMR.

example.name: buy-v
example.text: They finally bought him off for twenty dollars, and after waiting two days succeeded in getting the duplicates of their land.

example.name: buying_off-n
example.text: Their ability to operate freely may be the result of their buying off corrupt officials and using graft, extortion, intimidation, and murder to maintain their operations.
